docs: Controller Smart Contract
Handles the control (i.e. checks) for virtually all interactions with the protocol.
name: Controller

docs: Initializes the contract with an optional admin address.
# Arguments:
- `max_markets_per_account` - The maximum number of markets that a user can enter.
- `opt_admin` - An optional admin address for the contract.
Notes:
- If the contract is being deployed for the first time, the admin address will be set.
- If the admin address is not provided, the admin will be set as the deployer.
- If the contract is being upgraded, the admin address will not be overwritten.
Returns the current admin address.
endpoints.name: getAdmin

docs: Returns the current pending admin address, if there is one.
endpoints.name: getPendingAdmin

docs: Sets the pending admin address to the given address.
# Arguments:
- `new_pending_admin` - The new pending admin address.
endpoints.name: setPendingAdmin

docs: Attempts to accept the pending admin, which must be set first using the `set_pending_admin` endpoint.
endpoints.name: acceptAdmin

docs: Incorporates a money market in a list of accepted money markets (a whitelist). This action will add support for the
provided money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a valid money market smart contract.
- The money market should not has already been supported in the past.
- The collateral factor is set up as zero and should be updated by the owner afterwards via `set_collateral_factor`.
endpoints.name: supportMarket

docs: Sets the maximum number of money markets that can be entered per account.
# Arguments:
- `new_max_markets_per_account` - The new maximum number of money markets that can be entered per account.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- Must be higher than the current maximum.
endpoints.name: setMaxMarketsPerAccount

docs: Sets the collateral factor or loan to value for a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `new_collateral_factor` - The new collateral factor in wad.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
- The new collateral factor must not exceed the maximum allowed.
- A collateral factor of zero is configured when a market is deprecated.
endpoints.name: setCollateralFactor

docs: Sets the pricing Oracle smart contract address.
# Arguments:
- `new_price_oracle` - The address of the pricing oracle smart contract.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a valid oracle smart contract.
endpoints.name: setPriceOracle

docs: Sets a liquidity cap for a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `new_liquidity_cap` - The new liquidity cap in wad.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
endpoints.name: setLiquidityCap

docs: Sets a borrow cap for a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `new_borrow_cap` - The new borrow cap in wad.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
endpoints.name: setBorrowCap

docs: Sets the maximum amount of rewards batches per money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `new_max_rewards_batches` - The new maximum amount of rewards batches.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
endpoints.name: setMaxRewardsBatches

docs: Sets the maximum slippage allowed for configuration swaps.
# Arguments:
- `new_max_slippage` - The new maximum slippage allowed.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: setMaxSlippage

docs: Adds a rewards batch to the specified money market. EGLD or ESDT tokens are supported.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `market_type` - Distribute rewards for suppliers (`Supply`) or lenders (`Borrows`).
- `period` - The period of time in seconds in which rewards are distributed.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
- The provided address must be whitelisted money market.
- Should be paid with the rewards token.
endpoints.name: setRewardsBatch

docs: Adds an amount of reward token to an existing rewards batch maintaining the same speed.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - the rewards batch identifier
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
endpoints.name: addRewardsBatch

docs: Cancel a specified rewards batch. Remaining tokens are sent back to a beneficiary.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - the address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - the rewards batch identifier
- `opt_to` - the beneficiary address for the remaining tokens (optional)
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
- The caller is selected if no beneficiary is given.
endpoints.name: cancelRewardsBatch

docs: Removes a specified rewards batch from the array of rewards batches iff it has been fully distributed.
# Arguments
- `money_market` - the address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - the rewards batch identifier
# Notes
- can be called by anyone
- takes into consideration possible rounding errors but it is conservative
endpoints.name: removeRewardsBatch

docs: Removes a specified rewards batch from the array of rewards batches iff it has been fully distributed within a given
tolerance amount.
# Arguments
- `money_market` - the address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - the rewards batch identifier
- `tolerance` - the tolerance in wad, such that 1 wad = 100%.
# Notes
- can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
endpoints.name: adminRemoveRewardsBatch

docs: Updates a given rewards batch based on a new speed. The new speed of rewards also changes the remaining distribution
time period.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - the address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - The rewards batch identifier.
- `new_speed` - The new speed of rewards in wad.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
endpoints.name: updateRewardsBatchSpeed

docs: Updates a given rewards batch based on a new period. The new period also changes the speed of rewards.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - the address of the money market smart contract.
- `batch_id` - The rewards batch identifier.
- `new_dt` - The new period.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
endpoints.name: updateRewardsBatchRemainingPeriod

docs: Adds support for boosting rewards batches by converting the rewards batch tokens into Hatom's governance tokens with
a premium.
# Arguments:
- `governance_token_id` - the governance token identifier
- `egld_wrapper` - the address of the EGLD wrapper smart contract
- `router` - the address of the router smart contract
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: supportRewardsBatchBoosting

docs: Enables support for boosting rewards batches.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: enableRewardsBatchBoosting

docs: Disables support for boosting rewards batches.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: disableRewardsBatchBoosting

docs: Boosts the rewards of a given rewards token by converting the rewards tokens into Hatom's governance token with a
premium.
# Arguments:
- `premium` - the premium in wad, such that 1 wad = 100%.
- `fwd_swap_amount` - the amount of tokens to swap.
- `fwd_swap_path` - the swap path to convert the rewards batch tokens into Hatom's governance tokens.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
- If rewards token is EGLD, swaps will add a EGLD => WEGLD step first. Also, the swap path needs to use the WEGLD
token identifier.
endpoints.name: boostRewards

docs: Updates the premium of a given booster and, if a payment is provided, adds it to the booster's amount.
# Arguments:
- `rewards_token_id` - the rewards token identifier for which we wish to update its booster.
- `premium` - the premium in wad, such that 1 wad = 100%.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
- Cannot change the swap path. That requires canceling the booster and creating a new one.
endpoints.name: updateBooster

docs: Cancels a given booster and sends the remaining tokens back to the caller.
# Arguments:
- `rewards_token_id` - the rewards token identifier for which we wish to cancel its booster.
- `opt_to` - the beneficiary address for the remaining tokens (optional).
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or rewards manager.
endpoints.name: cancelBooster

docs: Updates the collateral or account tokens of a given account in a given money market. This is useful at liquidations.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `account` - The address of the account we wish to update.
- `tokens` - The number of Hatom's tokens to set as collateral.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by a whitelisted money market.
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
- Makes sure the mappers `account_markets` and `market_members` remain updated.
endpoints.name: setAccountTokens

docs: Sets the Rewards Manager of the protocol.
# Arguments:
- `new_rewards_manager` - The address of the new Rewards Manager.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: setRewardsManager

docs: Sets the Guardian of the protocol.
# Arguments:
- `new_pause_guardian` - The address of the new Guardian.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin.
endpoints.name: setPauseGuardian

docs: Whitelists a collateral or market observer contract, i.e. a contract that is notified when a change in a given market
occurs. This is useful for smart contracts that need to be notified when collateral is deposited or withdrawn from
the market at the controller.
# Arguments:
- `market_observer` - the market observer smart contract address.
# Notes
- can only be called by the admin
- `market_observer` must be a market observer smart contract
- `market_observer` must not be already added
endpoints.name: addMarketObserver

docs: Removes a market observer contract. From this point onwards, the market observer will not be notified of any changes
in any market.
# Arguments:
- `market_observer` - the market observer smart contract address.
endpoints.name: removeMarketObserver

docs: A market observer subscribes to receive notifications about collateral changes of a given market.
# Arguments:
- `market_observer` - the market observer smart contract address.
- `money_market` - the money market the market observer is interested in.
# Notes
- can only be called by the admin
- `market_observer` must already been added
- `money_market` must be a whitelisted money market
- `money_market` could have been already observed by the market observer
endpoints.name: subscribeMarketObserver

docs: A market observer unsubscribes from notifications about collateral changes of a given market.
# Arguments:
- `market_observer` - the market observer smart contract address.
- `money_market` - the money market the market observer is not anymore interested.
endpoints.name: unsubscribeMarketObserver

docs: Changes the minting status for a specific money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `pause` - A boolean that indicates whether the protocol must be or not paused.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or the Guardian.
endpoints.name: pauseMint

docs: Changes the borrowing status for a specific money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `pause` - A boolean that indicates whether the protocol must be or not paused.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or the Guardian.
endpoints.name: pauseBorrow

docs: Changes the seizing status for a specific money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `pause` - A boolean that indicates whether the protocol must be or not paused.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or the Guardian.
endpoints.name: pauseSeize

docs: Changes the seizing status (required for liquidations) for all money markets.
# Arguments:
- `pause` - A boolean that indicates whether the protocol must be or not paused.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by the admin or the Guardian.
endpoints.name: pauseGlobalSeize

docs: Payable endpoint used to enter to a one or many markets, i.e. provide collateral for sender liquidity calculations.
The sender can perform multiple calls to keep adding more collateral.
# Arguments:
- `opt_account` - If given, the collateral will be deposited on the name of this account. Can only be performed by a
whitelisted money market.
# Notes:
- Must be paid with one or many valid ESDT Hatom tokens
endpoints.name: enterMarkets

docs: Exits a given amount of tokens from a given money market, i.e. removes the caller's deposited collateral for
liquidity computations. If the amount of tokens is not specified, all the position is removed.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `opt_tokens` - If given, the amount of collateral tokens to remove.
# Notes:
- The provided address must be a whitelisted money market.
- The caller must have collateral in the corresponding money market.
- The amount of tokens to withdraw should not exceed the current deposited amount.
- The caller must not have an outstanding borrowed balance in the underlying asset.
- The caller must be providing the necessary collateral for any outstanding borrows.
endpoints.name: exitMarket

docs: Checks whether minting is allowed at a specified money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
# Notes:
- It does not depend on the account that intends to mint.
- Fails with panic and a clear error message or returns true.
endpoints.name: mintAllowed

docs: Checks whether an account (redeemer) should be allowed to withdraw a given amount of Hatom tokens from a given
market, i.e. withdraw collateral.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `redeemer` - The account that intends to withdraw the tokens.
- `tokens` - The amount of Hatom tokens to withdraw.
# Notes:
- This function is not used when redeeming at a money market, it is only used when redeeming (exiting the market) at
the controller.
- A simulation of the resulting risk profile is performed.
- Fails with panic and a clear error message, returns false if redeemer would become risky or true if she remains
solvent.
endpoints.name: redeemAllowed

docs: Checks whether an account (borrower) should be allowed to take a borrow of a given amount on a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `borrower` - The account that intends to take a borrow.
- `amount` - The amount of underlying to borrow.
# Notes:
- Fails with panic and a clear error message, returns false if borrower would become risky or true if she remains
solvent.
endpoints.name: borrowAllowed

docs: Checks whether repaying a borrow is allowed at a specified money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `borrower` - The address of the borrower.
# Notes:
- It does not depend on the account that intends to repay the borrow.
endpoints.name: repayBorrowAllowed

docs: Checks whether a liquidation is allowed or not to happen, repaying a borrow at a given money market and seizing
collateral at the same or another specified money market.
# Arguments:
- `borrow_mma` - The money market where the borrower has borrow its underlying.
- `collateral_mma` - The money market where the borrower has collateral which is intended to be seized.
- `borrower` - The address of the borrower.
- `amount` - The amount of underlying being repaid by the liquidator.
# Notes:
- Borrows at deprecated markets can be fully repaid (the close factor does not play any role).
- Fails with panic and a clear error message, returns false if the borrower cannot be liquidated (i.e. the borrower
is solvent) or true if the liquidation can be performed (i.e. the borrower is risky and repayment amount does not
exceeds its maximum allowed).
endpoints.name: liquidateBorrowAllowed

docs: Checks whether seizing is or not allowed.
# Arguments:
- `collateral_mma` - The money market where the borrower has collateral which is intended to be seized.
- `borrow_mma` - The money market where the borrower has borrow its underlying.
- `borrower` - The address of the borrower.
- `liquidator` - The address of the liquidator.
# Notes:
- Money markets should be whitelisted and share the same Controller.
endpoints.name: seizeAllowed

docs: Updates rewards batches states.
# Arguments:
- `supply` - Whether or not to update supply rewards.
- `borrow` - Whether or not to update borrow rewards..
- `money_markets` - The money market addresses to update rewards in. If empty, all whitelisted markets will be used.
endpoints.name: updateRewardsBatchesState

docs: Distributes caller or specified accounts rewards from supply and/or borrow markets, at specific money markets.
# Arguments:
- `supply` - Whether or not to distribute supply rewards.
- `borrow` - Whether or not to distribute borrow rewards.
- `money_markets` - The money market addresses to distribute rewards in. If empty, all whitelisted markets will be
used.
- `accounts` - The addresses to distribute rewards for. If empty, the caller will be used.
endpoints.name: distributeRewards

docs: Claims caller or specified accounts rewards from supply and/or borrow markets, at specific money markets.
# Arguments:
- `boost` - Whether or not to boost rewards whenever possible.
- `supply` - Whether or not to claim supply rewards.
- `borrow` - Whether or not to claim borrow rewards.
- `money_markets` - The money market addresses to claim rewards in. If empty, all whitelisted markets will be used.
- `accounts` - The addresses to claim rewards for. If empty, the caller will be used.
endpoints.name: claimRewards

docs: Checks whether an account is risky or not by computing its current risk profile.
# Arguments:
- `account` - The account we wish to analyze.
endpoints.name: isRisky

docs: Performs a risk profile simulation for a given account, considering its current opened positions and simulating
either redeeming or borrowing (or both) in a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `account` - The account we wish to analyze.
- `this_money_market` - The money market address used for the borrow or redeem simulation (or both).
- `redeem_tokens` - The amount of Hatom tokens to be redeemed for underlying at `this_money_market`.
- `borrow_amount` - The amount of underlying to be borrowed at `this_money_market`.
- `lazy` - If true, the simulation will return a solvent risk profile with a dummy liquidity if the account is not a
borrower. If false, the simulation will be performed in full, even if it is not a borrower (i.e. Solvent by
definition).
endpoints.name: simulateRiskProfile

docs: A utility function to highlight that this smart contract is a Controller.
endpoints.name: isController

docs: Checks whether the specified money market address has already been whitelisted.
# Arguments:
- `sc_address` - The address of the money market to check.
endpoints.name: isWhitelistedMoneyMarket

docs: Checks whether the specified token identifier has already been whitelisted.
# Arguments:
- `token_id` - The token identifier to check.
endpoints.name: isWhitelistedTokenId

docs: Checks whether the specified address is a whitelisted market observer.
# Arguments:
- `sc_address` - The address of the market observer to check.
endpoints.name: isWhitelistedMarketObserver

docs: Gets a whitelist or set of supported money market addresses as an array.
endpoints.name: getWhitelistedMarkets

docs: Gets the the set of money markets addresses in which the account has entered as an array. An account is considered to
be in the market if it has deposited collateral or took a borrow. Currently, after a borrow is fully repaid, the
account is still considered to be in the market.
endpoints.name: getAccountMarkets

docs: Gets the maximum collateral factor allowed
endpoints.name: getMaxCollateralFactor

docs: Gets the amount of Hatom tokens deposited as collateral for a given money market and account.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
- `account` - The account we wish to analyze.
endpoints.name: getAccountTokens

docs: Gets the total amount of collateral tokens deposited into the controller for a specific money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market for which to retrieve the total collateral tokens.
# Notes:
- If the market has no collateral, returns 0.
endpoints.name: getTotalCollateralTokens

docs: Gets the current minting status at a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
# Notes:
- By default, mint is active (returns the first enum value).
endpoints.name: getMintStatus

docs: Gets the current borrowing status at a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
# Notes:
- By default, borrow is active (returns the first enum value).
endpoints.name: getBorrowStatus

docs: Gets the current seizing status at a given money market.
# Arguments:
- `money_market` - The address of the money market smart contract.
# Notes:
- By default, seize is active (returns the first enum value).
endpoints.name: getSeizeStatus

docs: Gets the current global seizing status at a given money market.
# Notes:
- By default, global seize is active (returns the first enum value).
endpoints.name: getGlobalSeizeStatus

docs: Gets the accrued rewards for a given account's address and rewards token ID.
# Arguments:
- `supplier` - A reference to a `ManagedAddress` representing the supplier's address.
- `rewards_token_id` - A reference to an `EgldOrEsdtTokenIdentifier` representing the rewards token's ID.
endpoints.name: getAccountAccruedRewards

docs: Whitelisted money markets can burn their own tokens deposited at the controller Burns an amount of deposited Hatom's
tokens.
# Arguments:
- `token_id` - The token identifier for the Hatom token.
- `tokens` - The amount of tokens to be burnt.
# Notes:
- Can only be called by a whitelisted money market.
- A money market can only burn Hatom tokens corresponding to their own token type.
endpoints.name: burnTokens

docs: Computes the amount of Hatom tokens to be seized given an underlying repayment amount performed by the liquidator.
Takes into consideration the liquidation incentive, such that the liquidator gets tokens at a discount.
# Arguments:
- `borrow_mma` - The money market where the borrower has borrow its underlying.
- `collateral_mma` - The money market where the borrower has collateral which is intended to be seized.
- `amount` - The amount of underlying being repaid by the liquidator.
endpoints.name: tokensToSeize

docs: Stores the guardian address.
endpoints.name: getPauseGuardian

docs: Stores the rewards manager address.
endpoints.name: getRewardsManager

docs: Stores a whitelisted market address given a token identifier.
endpoints.name: getMoneyMarketByTokenId

docs: Stores both the underlying identifier and the token identifier associated to a whitelisted money market.
endpoints.name: getIdentifiersByMoneyMarket

docs: Stores the set of addresses that belong to a given money market.
endpoints.name: getMarketMembers

docs: Stores the maximum amount of markets an account can enter at any given point in time.
endpoints.name: getMaxMarketsPerAccount

docs: Stores the price oracle smart contract address.
endpoints.name: getPriceOracle

docs: Stores the collateral factor for each money market.
endpoints.name: getCollateralFactor

docs: A supported money market might have a liquidity cap, which is stored here.
endpoints.name: getLiquidityCap

docs: A supported money market might have a borrowing cap, which is stored here.
endpoints.name: getBorrowCap

docs: Stores the rewards index for a given account and rewards token in the specified money market.
endpoints.name: getAccountRewardsIndex

docs: Stores the ID of the next rewards batch in the specified money market.
endpoints.name: getNextRewardsBatchId

docs: Stores the maximum amount of batches allowed per market.
endpoints.name: getMaxRewardsBatchesPerMarket

docs: Stores the maximum allowed slippage.
endpoints.name: getMaxSlippage

docs: Stores the list of rewards batches in the specified money market.
endpoints.name: getRewardsBatches

docs: Stores the current position of a rewards batch in the specified money market at the corresponding VecMapper.
endpoints.name: getRewardsBatchPosition

docs: Stores the rewards batch booster for a given rewards token identifier.
endpoints.name: getRewardsBooster

docs: Stores wrapped EGLD smart contract address.
endpoints.name: getEgldWrapper

docs: Stores the token identifier of the wrapped EGLD token.
endpoints.name: getWegldId

docs: Event emitted when the pending admin is updated.
Event emitted when the admin is updated.
Emitted when a new market is supported.
Emitted when an account enters a market, i.e. deposits tokens as collateral.
Emitted when an account exits a market, i.e. removes tokens from collateral.
Emitted when a new maximum number of markets that can be entered per account is set.
Emitted when a market observer is added.
Emitted when a market observer is removed.
Emitted when a market observer subscribes to a market.
Emitted when a market observer unsubscribes to a market.
Emitted when a new collateral factor is defined for a given money market.
Emitted when the price oracle is modified.
Emitted when a new liquidity cap is defined for a given money market.
Emitted when a new borrow cap is defined for a given money market.
Emitted when a new maximum amount of rewards batches is defined for a given money market.
Emitted when a new maximum slippage is defined.
Emitted when a new guardian is set.
Emitted when a new rewards manager is set.
Event emitted when mint is paused or unpaused.
Event emitted when borrow is paused or unpaused.
Event emitted when seize is paused or unpaused.
Event emitted when global seize is paused or unpaused.
Event emitted when supplier rewards are distributed.
Event emitted when borrower rewards are distributed.
Event emitted when rewards are claimed by a user.
Event emitted when a rewards batch is set.
Event emitted when a rewards batch adds more rewards.
Event emitted when a rewards batch is cancelled.
Event emitted when a rewards batch is removed.
Event emitted when the rewards batch speed is updated.
Event emitted when the remaining period of a rewards batch is updated.
Event emitted when the supply rewards batch index is updated.
Event emitted when the borrow rewards batch index is updated.
Event emitted when rewards batch boosting is supported.
Event emitted when rewards batch boosting is enabled.
Event emitted when rewards batch boosting is disabled.
Event emitted when rewards are boosted for a specific rewards token.
Event emitted when a booster is updated for a specific rewards token.
Event emitted when a booster is cancelled for a specific rewards token.
Event emitted when boosted rewards are claimed.
